felix_1257.name: Felix
felix_1257.bio: happy, the Roman procurator of Judea before whom Paul "reasoned" ( Acts 24:25 ). He appears to have expected a bribe from Paul, and therefore had several interviews with him. The "worthy deeds" referred to in 24:2 was his clearing the country of banditti and impostors.

fortunatus_1258.name: Fortunatus
fortunatus_1258.bio: Fortunate, a disciple of Corinth who visited Paul at Ephesus, and returned with Stephanas and Achaicus, the bearers of the apostle's first letter to the Corinthians (1 Cor. 16:17).
